text: I will unfortunately never get that 2 hours and 20 minutes of my lofe back. The only way this has any positive reviews is someone was paid for it. DON'T WATCH

Finally watching Leave the World Behind, and I’m disappointed in myself for taking this long.

Sam Esmail (Mr. Robot, Leave the World Behind) is one of the very few film directors I’d call a philosopher-auteur. The ideas he posits are not mere political commentary, extrapolated in some rote, overused, and mundane fashion, nor are they elaborate existential musings drawn from experience alone. Instead, his work is philosophically rigorous, seeking to unravel and locate the underpinnings of selfhood, the boundaries of the real, and the epistemological. Much like traditional philosophy, Esmail doesn’t necessarily claim to have the answers; he is seeking truth through his work.

That said, as a movie, the film has some minor issues that undercuts its total potential.
Starts well then sort of bogs down a bit. Still I liked it.
This was the most meaningless movie I’ve ever watched.
One of the movies without an ending. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. Great actors but super disappointing in the end when the movie abruptly finishes and the story never ends.

I didn't like the length of this movie. Unnecessarily long. There were lots of moments that felt like you're watching a horror when it was a specific melody that was building something that must've end on the shocking plot twist but instead it was like "Oh... and kinda nothing happens... But okay. The movie is not bad at all. I really enjoyed the acting. I would actually recommend to watch it. So instead of rewatching the millionth time "Titanic" you can dive into this. Because one thing that they have in common - is the length. I don't regret watching it. It's one of those movies that's really good to watch in the movie theater tho. The end gagged me.

I’ve watched this movie three times, and I LOVE it. The story is great, and cinematography is really really fabulous. Blue/orange colour way, the lighting, long continuous shots, the tilted camera angles, ohhhhh I just can’t get enough of it. You can tell every shot was considered. This movie just fills my soul with glee.

“Leave the World Behind” looked like it was gonna be a wild end-of-the-world ride — tech collapse, mystery strangers, society crumbling. Instead… it tucked me in like a grandma with chamomile tea.

This movie is such a complete waste of time that my brain literally said, “Nope,” and powered itself off. I fell asleep mid-apocalypse. How do you mess that up? The world is ending and I’m over here drooling on the pillow.

It keeps teasing big answers and big shocks, but then it’s just… characters arguing about phone chargers and deer staring into the camera like they forgot their lines. Nothing pays off. Nothing gets explained. You keep waiting for the “Aha!” moment — but the only thing that arrives is REM sleep.

The cast is amazing — Julia Roberts, Ethan Hawke, Mahershala Ali — all doing their best to act dramatic while absolutely nothing happens around them. It’s like watching top-tier actors stuck in a loading screen.

That’s why I officially rename it:

“Leave the World Behind: The Lullaby Edition.”
Guaranteed to cure insomnia better than melatonin.

Movies are supposed to keep you on the edge of your seat, not knock you out colder than airplane mode. If you want thrills, look elsewhere. If you want a nap? This is premium content.
Weird apocalyptic movie. I enjoyed it. Good acting and decent special effects. Makes you think how vulnerable all the tech can make us. Worth a watch at 3.5 stars.

Wasted 2 hours and 21 minuets of my life watching this film 
Was amazing leading up to the ending 
The ending however was disappointing to say the least 
We don’t even get to watch the outcome of what the film was building up to 
Wouldn’t recommend 
Go watch transformers instead
So painful.  Bad writing, bad dialogue, even top actors couldn't make it work.  So cliche and ugly, the characters are so off putting.  Lame ending.  Yuck yuck yuck, what a waste of time.

Good one. Strong acting (Ali is a phenomenon but the entire case is very, very good), amazing camera work, expert pacing.
Skillful play with viewers expectations and hideously tying several ways to create tension in a row.
I do deduct half a star from an otherwise 5-star movie because the ending is too abrupt and leaves a lot of things unexplained.
Yes I know the movie's point is not the things that cause the collapse but how people react to it.
But I do want the story to make sense on the direct level (sorry).
This had the makings of a great Movie.... dont watch it! Its TRASH 😡🤬 we all know "friends" never goes out of style or that this movie only ever ends in your mind.

The movie was good at the beginning but towards the end it wasn't good at all and the ending made the sense to me nobody wants to see a ending where it's just a lil girl watching the last episode of her shown inside of a bunker idk if they are planning on continuing the movie with another but this movie wasted 2 hours of my time just to see it end in such a stupid way

This movie has severely gotten under my skin and I figured I would watch and continue to understand but the plot has no structure. It seems that there was no set direction that the producers wanted to take it, so they threw everything they thought of into it at once. The ending was the worst and left so many open ended questions.

Filled with tension and uncertainty--what you would expect at the end of the world. Realistic arc of affluent characters from entitlement to humility as control over their individual circumstances slowly dissipates. There is no bow at the end of this one, folks, loose ends abound. Just as in real life, the characters'--and the world's--future remains nebulous.

Would love to give a good review. The ending of a movie is the most important part. Leaving the viewer on a cliffhanger just to "open discussion" is a terrible way to go about things with no plan to release a sequel. As a whole it's a okay movie. It leaves you asking questions, but questions you never get the answer to, in my opinion is an incomplete movie. 140 minutes of filler episodes from your favorite show is what it felt like. Guessing is one thing, but never receiving an answer just makes you feel like you wasted your time. Would love to see a sequel, but without one, I could never recommend this movie.
I thought it was going to be a great movie but when I seen the ending I was disappointed.

This was the worst movie I've seen in a long time.   It keeps you on the edge of your seat of wanting something to happen, anything to happen.   Nothing happens in the entire movie.   There are a few scenes throughout the movie where you'd think this movie is about to go somewhere and it never does.   The positive takes is the acting is decent and the cinematography is good.   The tense music throughout the movie almost always leads to no where.  There's only questions throughout the entire movie and not in a thought provoking way.   I was desperately waiting for this movie to end.   I thought at this point any ending could help this movie until i saw the ending.   Quite possibly the worst ending in a movie, all time.   DO NOT WASTE 2 HOURS AND 20 MINUTES, This movie was garbage.

I feel like this movie does not deserve the low rating it has. Too many people expect a plot to be spoon-fed to them and every answer given, instead of using their critical thinking skills to connect the dots. It was wonderfully acted. The plot was suspenseful and interesting, and the ending was perfectly fine. I totally understand where they wanted you to go in terms of thinking for yourself. If you have half a brain, you could put two and two together and figure out what was gonna happen after the screen went black, you didn’t need to see it.
